judgement.reason: A divalent cation can be any ion with a +2 charge, including non-metal ions, whereas a divalent metal cation specifically refers to metal ions with a +2 charge.
A divalent cation is any cation with a +2 charge, which can include non-metal cations, while a divalent metal cation specifically refers to metal ions with a +2 charge.
